headline: Baked Homemade Macaroni and Cheese
description: This baked mac and cheese recipe features a Cheddar cheese sauce and a buttery cracker topping. Guaranteed to please any night of the week!

video.description: A buttery cracker topping and rich cheese sauce make it a family favorite.
video.name: Baked Homemade Macaroni and Cheese

name: Baked Homemade Macaroni and Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain well.

Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flour and salt; cook, stirring constantly, for 2 minutes. Whisk in milk and simmer, stirring frequently, until mixture thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.

Turn off the heat and stir in Cheddar cheese until cheese is melted. Add macaroni and stir to coat; pour into a 9x13-inch baking dish. Mix the remaining 1/4 cup of melted butter and crushed crackers together in a bowl; scatter evenly over macaroni mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I love this and I’ve made it 6 times. Cause ppl love it. I did add two boxes of Mac and not two cups. And I did however add 1/4 tspn of garlic powder to the flour and butter mix before I added the milk. And I added more cheese while mixing the Mac in the cheese sauce. Butter it’s still awesome

I like the simple recipe but didn't like the flour to milk ratio, couldn't get the sauce to thicken until I added in another 1/4 cup of flour to finally get it thickened, next time I use less milk! Good but I added in more spices to it! Thank you I will probably use this recipe always! Came out perfect in my mini oven!
Real good not much of a fan of the crackers but liven the easy and quick recipe and. I added a crumble of Crispy bacon bits Yum!

This turned out great. Pretty basic and great to put your own twist on it. I made it as-is: 5 stars. I made it a second time my way, simply using a whole 16 oz box and half teaspoon mustard powder. In spite of using 1.5c MORE shell macaroni, it came out great. Note to self: Piper liked this one a lot and asked me to save it =)
me and the wife love it i make for it for all the holidays and i never have leftovers
Smoked it
Very tasty. Nice consistency. Too much topping...next time I'll use 1/2c bread crumbs.
Family LOVED it!! The only thing I did different was I used bread crumbs and a different cheese blend. We will make it again.

It was ok. I had wayyyyy too much cheese sauce. Thankfully I added it to the pasta a little at a time and only used half of it. The milk and roux never thickened when it simmered, but the cheese did make it thicker. I knew it would set more while it baked, so the consistency ended up being ok. It would have been soup if I’d used all the sauce. The cheese sauce also had a somewhat grainy texture even though my roux was smooth and I used a block of cheddar that I shredded myself. I used sharp cheddar and then added some Parmesan and Monterey Jack that I had on hand because it tasted bland when I sampled it. I would make this again but use half the milk, add different cheeses for a stronger flavor, and add some mustard powder and pepper.
I've made this several times family always wants it. So meetings I use not pe paper cheese or jalopeno h M
I used Rotini instead of Elbows, used Pepper Jack cheese, grated some Parmesan in with the crumbs, steamed some broccoli and mixed in there also. Used almond milk , fantastic taste …..

I made this more than once and it's always a huge hit! I really like that the crackers make the mac and cheese taste buttery. I do add extra cheese in to make sure it's a cheesy delicious dinner that my family and especially I will always enjoy!
Plain unless you jazz it up. Dijon mustard, salt,pepper, cayenne and paprika, garlic and onion powder added along with seasoned bread crumbs ritz crackers and parmigiana cheese to the topping

Very good base, I added a pinch each of cayenne, pepper flakes, cinnamon, & cumin- delicious flavor that paired well with the creaminess of the sharp cheddar. I cut the recipe in half, but used a little more than half of real butter in the rye. Baked to a bubbly golden doneness in 30 mintues.
Meh… no flavor

I loved it! It’s definitely a favorite in my family. The only thing I did with this recipe was to add less milk. Instead of 4 cups, I put about 3 1/2 cups. I started out with that amount first but I could use a little less next time. It’s was delicious!
Easy to make, very taste. I used oat milk as a replacement to cow milk
Omg, this was sooo good. I added garlic powder, onion powder & paprika per other reviews, but otherwise, it was perfect!

Had all of the ingredients on hand so I thought I would give it a try. It was easy to make and turned out good, but lacks seasoning. It seems very bland even with all of the cheese. I added some paprika and mustard before baking. If I try it again I would be sure to add some fresh minced onion and garlic. I added some sriracha after I tried it as it needed something.
I added some twice cooked pork belly to go full-on decadent... ‘Twas Good
Delicious. Sprinkled top with more cheese instead of crackers and shredded sharp cheddar cheese. Will definitely make again.

This recipe came out great! Used Cabot bacon cheddar cheese, very nice taste! Baked it a little less time, about 37 minutes.

Really an easy & yummy Macaroni and cheese, and you can pick different cheeses & add ins.
Perfect!!!!
This recipe was really easy to make but it was really bland, the cheese came out super grainy

I served it with kielbasa and green beans. I didn’t care for the ritz cracker topping because it just tasted like ..... ritz crackers. I didn’t like thickening the cheese sauce with flour because it gave it a slightly grainy texture.

Made for 3 servings with a sharp cheddar and added a small grilled and chopped ham steak. Cut back on the crackers significantly and omitted the extra butter in a 6x9 casserole, served with a small salad. Was 4 servings for 2 adult light eaters. Will try again with dry mustard with ham and a splash of Tabasco. Sour cream and chives would work well if serving as a side dish without meat.
I followed the recipe exactly except that I put it back on low heat for a bit to get the cheese to melt. It turned out well!
We didn't like it at all. The cheese was gritty, and there was no flavor and we used sharp cheddar.
This was bomb! I used Colby jack snd sharp cheddar cheeses.
This was really good, my family loved this Recipe......
I added more cheese and I think I'll omit the crushed crackers next time. My guys liked it. That's a good thing!
Best Max and cheese I made so far. Before I put the cracker topping on I added slices of boars head Munster cheese. I also changed the type of cheddar I used. I used extra sharp
Loved it!
Too rich. It was average

I made this exactly as instructed it came out great. The 2nd time I made it I added crispy bacon with the butter and cracker mix about 8oz or 8 strips. The 3rd time I made it I add a pound of sautéed shrimp after I added the macaroni. I diced up the shrimp and it was delicious. I will make this again it is very easy and very cheesy.
We didnt like the texture of the sauce

I made this recipe tonight! It was amazing!!! I did cut it in half for just the 2 of us and it still worked out. 
I made a couple of modifications.
I fried up 3 slices of bacon and used the fat as the butter. I chopped it up and added it and a half cup of parm to the crackers.
I added a little nutmeg to the recipe because I'm obsessed with nutmeg and cheese sauces!!!

The best mac and cheese, even adapting it to gluten free for the celiac people. Just sub in gluten free flour and we use gluten free breadcrumbs instead of Ritz. We also usually do half sharp cheddar and half whatever other kind of cheese we might have. I especially liked gouda. Try putting some slightly browned onions coated in a little flour in with the noodles and cheese as well. Fantastic!
It was fairly easy to make. A little bland. I would use sharp cheddar next time. I used carnation canned milk because I don't drink homogenized milk. That may have made it a little dry.
Easy and delicious!

This is based off a very old recipe that I've seen in a 1920s cookbook. We've made similar in our family since at least the 1940s. As others have mentioned, it is excellent with some dried mustard added. Many leave it out, but I think it is actually in the original recipe. It is also excellent with a couple of tablespoons of very finely chopped onion, cooked until soft in the butter before added the flour. I don't always add the onion when I make it, but it is an alternative I use sometimes. Also, I know some people who have picky children with problems eating certain textures of food sometimes leave the crackers off the top. We prefer this old fashioned recipe to many more modern, complicated ones.
I didn't have a "sleeve of buttery round crackers" so I used Ritz crackers instead.
I love this roux. It’s all pretty quick and I even shredded the cheese myself. I divided the recipe
I used mex cheese and added 8 strips of cooked crushed bacon. It was to die for! Going to add this to the Thanksgiving dinner.
One of our all time comfort food dishes. This is a go to recipe!!!
I added crab meat and a splash of cocktail sauce with horseradish. Delicious!
Nice easy recipe and the buttery crackers were nice and crunchy. The portions are huge though. Cut it down
Absolutely love it! Even picky family members love it! I always make a double order!
Good comfort food. Crushed crackers can be substituted with crushed corn flakes, or bread crumbs bread crumbs (Pinko is ideal). They all toast well.

I’m not sure what I did wrong but it was grainy. I used sharp cheddar and it never fully melted. I was so hopeful but this recipe sent me to the store to purchase more ingredients to make a new recipe instead as we had friends coming for dinner. So disappointed

2 1/2 C macaroni to a sauce made with 4 cups of milk! I had to make another pot of macaroni to add to the first 2 1/2 cups, and even then I had half the sauce left over. I wonder how Katie ever used all that sauce with 2 1/2 c macaroni. Sorry I made this.

Thank you for a classic and very forgiving recipe with amazing results. I messed up my flour measurement and had to add half of it after the milk with no adverse result. It just took a little longer to thicken. I halved the recipe and added a few shakes each of garlic powder, ground mustard, and smoked cayenne to the butter and flour. Wonderful. Thank you.
Great recipe! Made it for 4 and added bacon! Not a crumb left!
i used two boxes of Kraft macaroni & subbed heavy cream as we were out of milk- turned out delicious. my family says I'm going to make them fat, lol.
Easy to make! I also shredded 8oz of pepper jack cheese to add and sprinkled in some garlic powder and paprika. Substituted Cheez It’s because I didn’t have Ritz crackers.

My first attempt at homemade Mac & cheese and I’m very happy with it. Next time I rotate the baking pan halfway through, as my oven must have a hot spot to the back left. The sole change I made was to use a half box of pasta instead of the recommended amount, only because I didn’t want boxes of pasta with odd amounts left over (ocd). The measured amount would been somewhat more, but it came up to the rim of the baking pan anyway, so it was probably for the best.
My family loved it!! I doubled up on the crumbs.
This was really good and easy! I followed directions as is!
I used the original club crackers instead and oh my goodness! Delish!
Nothing special. Didn't have much flavor

One of the best recipes I have seen for baked mac and cheese where the amount of ingredients was dead on for the outcome. I had various pieces of different cheeses and tossed them all in together. Delicious!

I get so many compliments when I make this macaroni-it’s so easy to make. You can get creative and add difference types of cheeses. I also add a good amount of garlic powder, creole seasonings, and paprika. If you let the butter brown a bit you get a nice smoked flavor with it as well!
It was delicious.

I made this for second time. the flavor was good. Serve it after setting only 10 minutes, otherwise it goes dry, not creamy. you could add more milk to the roux. or not add an extra 1/4 lb. of cheese like I did. I loved the topping with parmesan cheese and a bit of Panko to the crackers. Perfect, crunchy.. I had taco seasoned "Mexican blend" shreaded cheese to use up, and it was flavorful, not too much. Added the 1/2 tsp. of ground mustard as others suggested. Liked it better. The best suggestion I can give you is to disregard trying to brown up the topping. Cooking this longer to do so dries it out. Stick with the suggested cook time in the recipe and you should have a creamy mac and cheese.
So bad. In fact, so bad - not even a duel could amend this determination.
Tasty. Next time I will go for less fat
I don't normally rate recipes but this one was fantastic.
Great Mac and cheese, used sharp cheese to add to flavour.
Simple and delicious
No changes. Great as is.
Everyone loved this!

This is my first baked macaroni and cheese attempt. My mom used to make it all the time when I was a kid but I’ve never made it and my children are straight up teenagers now. I did a mix of pepper jack and sharp cheddar cheese, I added a tablespoon of Dijon mustard and a couple sprinkles of onion powder. For the topping I did a combination of Ritz crackers and Cheeze Its . It was delicious and I’ll definitely be making it again.

It’s a great basic recipe. I tweaked it a little. I used 8 Oz cheddar and 8oz whipped cream cheese with scallions and chives. I also used pandora breadcrumbs instead of crackers. It was crunchy and delicious. I will definitely make this again.
My grown children love it! They won’t hear of me making Mac any other ay now.

This is a great recipe. I did make the changes to it. The first change was I split the cheese between cheddar and mozzarella. Mozzarella just makes her a really creamy sauce. Every second thing I did was add crumbled bacon to it. Because bacon makes everything better. Gold rounds were a great idea. I made this for a Thanksgiving side and it disappeared.

I just made this tonight, we had company over. Everyone had second helpings, and a few had third helpings! I've made many mac and cheese recipes, this is by far the best. I followed it exactly, except for adding maybe a quarter cup or so of extra grated cheddar to the topping.
Great recipe. Didn't add the extra butter to the crackers at the end.
Turned out great. Made it for a Thanksgiving side dish and everyone loved it. Especially the kids, which includes teenage stepdaughter & her friends who seemed to like it the most.

I made this for the first time today and it was delish! I did make a few changes though... I used seasoned bread crumbs instead of the crackers, and I crumbled cooked bacon on top before I put it in the oven. What a crowd pleaser! Will definitely be making this again!
Good recipe. I would make it again.
This is a great recipe!! Everyone loved it. I made it like the directions say except I used sharp cheddar and put more sharp cheddar cheese on top instead of crackers. I will be making again.
I used the basic recipe but added an onion and I used gruyere and havarti cheese instead. It turned out very well. Sprinkle bread crumbs on top so they can toast and add crispness.

I made this recipe as directed. However, next time when whisking the flour butter salt mixture I will use a small saucepan and then transfer it to the larger one before adding milk. A big hit with kids and adults alike!
I used 3/4 heavy cream, and extra sharp cheddar. This was soo rich and creamy, it was delicious!
Used bread crumbs instead of crackers and would try different seasonings next time. Texture and creaminess good! Just a bit too blah for me as is.
it was really good the family loved it for better flavor i do recommend added different cheeses instead of just one but overall i loved it.

This came out great and was a big hit especially the topping. I doubled the recipe and the only change I made was that I used 1 pound Velveeta + 1/2 pound Colby Jack and 1/2 pound cheddar.
That made enough to serve 10 to 12 easily
No changes made
Loved it! I made it as it was written and will be making it again...soon!
It made the house smell good.

Turned out great! I was worried it was too soupy when it went into the oven but it thickened up from baking. I added a layer of cheddar cheese slices to the top, baked for about 10 minutes and then added the crushed crackers. It was a hit.
Without a doubt the best Mac and cheese recipe I have found! Made it exactly as written and it turned out perfect!
Easy to make and quite delicious.
We added a package of diced, cooked bacon. Super creamy and delicious!!
Best homemade Mac and cheese recipe I’ve ever made!
I only left out the topping and added a few pepper flakes. Will definitely make again.
For a better flavor I recommend seasoning.

Easy to make with just a few ingredients! It was awesome! My family loved it. Instead of using crackers which I did not have I used panko bread crumbs and added a little parmesan cheese (and a little paprika for color) mixed with the melted butter for the topping. It turned out great!

I made this for a family reunion. I had NO clue how to scale this to fit two 17x12 pans. I did a test run last night to see how the recipe would turn out and it was devoured!!! I forgot to take a pic last night but took one in the large pan. I did half cheddar and half sharp cheddar. Everything else I kept the same. It was very creamy last night. It probably would’ve set if I had it in the fridge overnight.
